attribute.name: for
attribute.description: The JSF id of a UIData component that this scroller will affect. If this attribute is not present then the datascroller must be a child of a UIData comopnent.

attribute.name: layout
attribute.description: The layout this scroller should render with. Default is 'table', 'list' is implemented as well. Additionally you can use 'singleList' - then the data-scroller will render a list, but not the paginator - same with the value 'singleTable'.

attribute.name: fastStep
attribute.description: step (pages) used for fastforward and fastrewind

attribute.name: pageIndexVar
attribute.description: A parameter name, under which the actual page index is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

attribute.name: pageCountVar
attribute.description: A parameter name, under which the actual page count is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

attribute.name: rowsCountVar
attribute.description: A parameter name, under which the actual rows count is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

attribute.name: displayedRowsCountVar
attribute.description: A parameter name, under which the actual displayed rows count is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

attribute.name: firstRowIndexVar
attribute.description: A parameter name, under which the actual first displayed row index is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

attribute.name: lastRowIndexVar
attribute.description: A parameter name, under which the actual last displayed row index is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: styleClass for scroller table

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: style for scroller table

attribute.name: paginator
attribute.description: If set true, then the paginator gets rendered

attribute.name: paginatorMaxPages
attribute.description: The maximum amount of pages to be displayed in the paginator.

attribute.name: paginatorTableClass
attribute.description: styleclass for pagingator

attribute.name: paginatorTableStyle
attribute.description: style for pagingator

attribute.name: paginatorColumnClass
attribute.description: styleClass for paginator's column

attribute.name: paginatorColumnStyle
attribute.description: style for paginator's column

attribute.name: paginatorActiveColumnClass
attribute.description: styleClass for paginator's column with pageIndex = currentPageIndex

attribute.name: paginatorActiveColumnStyle
attribute.description: style for paginator's column with pageIndex = currentPageIndex

attribute.name: paginatorRenderLinkForActive
attribute.description: 'true' - render a link for the paginator's column with pageIndex = currentPageIndex. Default-value is 'true'.

attribute.name: renderFacetsIfSinglePage
attribute.description: If set to false, the facets aren't renderd if all the lines are contained on a single page. Default is true.

attribute.name: nextStyleClass
attribute.description: style-class for dataScroller next-element

attribute.name: lastStyleClass
attribute.description: style-class for data-scroller last-element

attribute.name: fastfStyleClass
attribute.description: style-class for data-scroller fast-forward-element

attribute.name: fastrStyleClass
attribute.description: style-class for data-scroller fast-rewind-element

attribute.name: firstStyleClass
attribute.description: style-class for data-scroller first-element

attribute.name: previousStyleClass
attribute.description: style-class for data-scroller previous-element

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: True means that the default ActionListener should be executed immediately (i.e. during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle), rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

attribute.name: actionListener
attribute.description: MethodBinding pointing at method acception an ActionEvent with return type void.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the element is clicked.

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the element is double-clicked.
